result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher James Hintz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus supervision fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact with: Joe Bruflodt.    Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.    Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.    Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

court minutes filed.  12 months Jail imposed and stayed.  12 months Probation with the following conditions:    Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel,   Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs,   Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol,   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia, any counseling per the agent,   No contact with: J.B.,   Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.  $268 court costs and $250 DNA surcharge.  Set up payment plan with agent.  Submit DNA sample.
Factual basis found.    Court accepts plea to Count 1 as voluntarily and knowingly and intelligently made.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in.
signed by ADA R Gay
